reviews.text: Great place to shop and eat and grab drinks especially when the weather is nice. There is ice cream and the restaurants are all amazing. I'd definitely suggest stopping by. Even if you're just bored.

Pearl Street is just one of those historic places you have to come back to year after year even though urban renewal is charging in...much to some folks' dismay.  Lots of cool, one off, shops with street vendors and street people thrown in to make it interesting and you cautious...  Some of the shops and taverns deserve 5 stars even though one of my favorite roof top haunts now has its view of the mountains  blocked by a new monstrosity springing up  next door.  Still worth a visit.

I mean what is there to say about the iconic Pearl Street Mall?! It's really fun to walk up and down, checking out all of the overpriced shops and restaurants. There are some really cute little boutiques tucked away here. The atmosphere is relaxed and fun with occasional live street performers. Not a place to actually shop unless you have some serious dough to drop, but this is to be expected. My favorite places are the bookstore, LUSH, and the kite store, you must check them out!

We adore all Pearl Street has to offer! Rocket Fizz is our family's FAVORITE for candy, toys, soda and weird finds! Falafel King is awesome! Lush for the BEST bath products! The Cupboard is a local institution for all things kitchen-y. On the East end we love Cured for a quick bite and Snooze for a decadent breakfast! And it's all set at the foot of the splendid flatirons!

Pearl Street has 2 different seasons. When schools in session and when it's not. Boulder is a college town 9 months of the year. Its "Iconic" which translates to "trendy" which translates to pricey. Pearl street used to be filled with mom and pop, local ,cheap handmade stuff. Now its high end shops, trendy overpriced restaurants. Like the SanFransico vibe? You will like pearl street.
Great place to shop and eat and grab drinks especially when the weather is nice. There is ice cream and the restaurants are all amazing. I'd definitely suggest stopping by. Even if you're just bored.

Lots of cool, one off, shops with street vendors and street people thrown in to make it interesting and you cautious...  Some of the shops and taverns deserve 5 stars even though one of my favorite roof top haunts now has its view of the mountains  blocked by a new monstrosity springing up  next door.  Still worth a visit.

Pearl street used to be filled with mom and pop, local ,cheap handmade stuff. Now its high end shops, trendy overpriced restaurants. Like the SanFransico vibe? You will like pearl street.
It was amazing. Went there for 4 years and had A great time. Great education and sports.

I didn't like this school AT ALL. Horrible education. The teachers weren't even focused on teaching us most of the time. Campus is really small. Way more expensive then CSU. If you're thinking about going here, DONT!

Good school
#96 in US (US news)

Did a college visit summer 2018 with my twin boys.

The campus is beautiful and the immediate area around it is fantastic. 

No students there yet, but the location made a major impression on 2 potential applicants!

I was originally excited at the prospect of an all in clusive educational campus. However, when actually touring the facilities, I discovered that the college is lacking when it comes to true diversity. In fact, I would argue that the school actively oppresses and marginalizes the gaming community. For instance, the dorms had no gamer stations OwO, the e-girl pee was not served at the cafeteria, and, there were no gamer bathrooms. This was not the worst of it though, they're were over 3 known GYMS on the campus. It personally made me feel very insecure of my gamer body.  The further marginalization occurred when several of the students wore Bernie Sanders shirts. This man has actively prosecuted and cyberbullied gamers for hundreds of gamer years. 
However, the tots were alright.
It was amazing. Went there for 4 years and had A great time. Great education and sports.

I didn't like this school AT ALL. Horrible education. The teachers weren't even focused on teaching us most of the time. Campus is really small. Way more expensive then CSU. If you're thinking about going here, DONT!

Good school
#96 in US (US news)

However, the tots were alright.

The Fox Theatre is almost legendary for how stunning it is, and it simply cannot be put into words how great this place is to visit. For adults, they offer some alcoholic beverages, but for the children they have popcorn and candy and stuff like that. The views are great from every seat, and the actors they put on are the best in the south. Les Miserables was amazing to witness, and with the great views, nice staff, and plenty of eating options, it's going to be hard to pass in the south. Absolutely recommend to anyone who wants a more formal night on the town with their family, friend, or lover.

The Fox is one of Atlanta's great dames. It's a beautiful palace. Architecturally stunning Moorish style design. Great place to see Broadway shows and attend events in the grand Egyptian ballroom.  But had a blast seeing my girl Mariah Carey! The BEST!

I love the Fox. It is a great music venue. It’s hard to believe that this historic Arabian motif building was almost torn down. The venue has approximately 4,600 seats all with unobstructed views. We just saw Trevor Noah, and we have see other musicals and concerts.
If you’re visiting Atlanta it’s one of the “must see” places here for the history and a great experience. It is a pricey for drinks and refreshments but that’s expected.One of my favorite places in Atlanta.

The beautiful Fox Theater is a landmark  in Atlanta. Wonderfully restored many years ago. I recently saw Les Miserables and sat in the orchestra section toward the back. No problem seeing the stage and all of the actors. The sound was clean and loud enough to be easily heard. If you have never been, please go. The wonderful blue star lit sky inside the theatre is amazing. The only negative is the traffic and parking. Very congested.  Took almost 1 hour to just get out of the parking garage.

This establishment is one of my all time favorite places to be. It definitely is my happy place. I have been to a total of 6 Broadway Productions and they were all so different in style and The Fox theater housed them so well. Very happy to have this Majestic theater in Atlanta.

Very good, fast, cheap food. It’s the best Chinese food in town, although not all of the food is Chinese. The Restaurant could use a renovation sometime, and they do not accept cards for payment. This is very annoying because if you don’t have cash you have to go to Lucky’s to use the ATM which costs $3-$4 to use. It’s not like it costs that much to accept credit/debit cards because if they did they would gain a lot more sales, therefore you earn the money back. It is due to places like this that you will never see a cashless society.
Have not been there in six years. Just moved back to Boulder.  Always loved the ginger scallion shrimp.  It was awesome the same great taste and service. Best in Boulder!
Delicious authentic Chinese food. One of the best in Boulder. Always friendly staff, and clean restaurant.

Exactly what you want it to be. Take-out Chinese menu with all the stuff us americans are used to finding on the menu.

Be better if they delivered or took credit cards, but other than that, great stuff.
It's hard to find good Chinese in Boulder. But this place is AWESOME. Old school, low key and unassuming, yet still gets busy not long after they open up.

Their food is always fantastic. I've only been here a handful of times but always impressed with the food and the service. Top notch. Decor is modern and minimal. The only thing is that it is such a popular spot it can get loud in the restaurant.
Went for brunch — the lemon ricotta pancakes were super delicious. A little pricey, but the quality is great. Nice atmosphere as well!
I sat at the bar and ordered the gem salad with salmon. The food was delicious and for me the perfect amount. The atmosphere is bright and welcoming and the staff were attentive.
Great ambiance.  Great food.  Good people!  The Kitchen and the Kitchen Upstairs are excellent spots to enjoy good company and fine wines💕

Sustainable cooking practice with farm to table organic foods. Be seen with locals and  celebs in a bright, open indoor / outdoor seating arrangement.  Be sure note where you actually are because Next Door is more bar food and Upstairs is a limited menu more for intimate evening socializing at the bar or the big farm table.

I literally do not know how to put into words how delicious the Lady London Fog tea is. Its creamy, delicious, slightly floral, and vanilla-y notes are absolutely mind blowing. I didn't think I really liked tea before I came here and now I'm all over it. Service was also incredible and very friendly staff with a relaxing atmosphere. Even with the place packed, I still felt comfortable in there.

The most relaxing part of our stay in Colorado so far. There was a short wait around 2pm on a Sunday but well worth it to sit outside on their patio next to running water. The Mediterranean Salad is phenomenal and so was their chilled chai with a distinct kick of cinnamon

The tea selection is amazing here. They do a very good job curating a wide selection to match any pallette. And oh man, the food is amazing. They often have special menus and events which are always fantastic. The service is top notch, and you can't ask for more beautiful scenery. This is somewhere you need to go.

Beautiful inside and out but there weren’t many vegan options which was disappointing. Ended up having the hummus plate which was very tasty and the Blue Moon tea which had a distinct blueberry flavor and aroma. Would definitely recommend it if you like blueberries.

Just ate breakfast with a friend and it was wonderful. Staff was pleasant and attentive. I had the Pork Belly Bahn Mi, it was a big tasty mess with a fresh bowl of fruit. My buddy had the Eggs Benedict with roasted potatoes. We could not have been happier.

The perfect place to grab breakfast, lunch, or dinner. The breakfast bowls are made to order, and will definitely fill you up and  start your day right. The service if fast, friendly, and you can tell how good the food is by the line that goes out the door for lunch. A fair value for the amount of food they give you. So if you love fast, friendly service and delicious food, Illegal Pete's on Pearl Street is the perfect stop for breakfast, lunch and dinner.
Always delicious. During peak times there can be a bit of a wait but what are you gonna do? It's good and a lot of people want it. Great value.

Awesomeness 101....
This was my first time here, but I loved it. Would be even better in summer when it's not so cold.

If You’re a CU Boulder student who wants a burrito. Go to this location after 7 and take advantage of free parking. 

If you’re a CU Boulder student who wants a bar to drink at, go to the one on the hill. 

If you go to the one on the hill on the weekend and find it too crowded, this location is your answer. This one is focused on food on the weekends. The other one is a bar on the weekends.

Very nice fast and friendly service along with yummy fish tacos and i really enjoyed their selection of drink choices too!!👍👍

Down to earth and very kind people vibe made me feel compfy and quite welcome!!☺☺ Next time visiting i plan on inviting several friends to join me too.

If you like my review click the like icon below please...

Was having a weekend in Boulder with friends and popped in here for lunch due to the good reviews. Was even better than expected. Tavern was warm and cozy on a cold, snowy day. Delicious appetizers, drafts, mixed drinks and sandwiches! Service was just right without being bothersome. We all loved each of our meals and never felt over crowded or rushed! A great place to relax a couple of hours.

Had a business lunch here in the upstairs area.  It was very nice, warm and cozy. Our server was great, very attentive!  The food was also good and overall great atmosphere.  Would definitely recommend for a quick bite for some great BBQ or burgers.
Amazing location, amazing food, friendly staff. I loved sitting upstairs on the rooftop with a view of the mountains. Had a great time and great meal. Will definitely be back.

We loved our visit to the West End Tavern! Burgers were fantastic, and the waitress was absolutely top notch. When one member of your party has a special diet, it can be difficult to go out. Here, the waitress listened and asked questions enough so that she understood the restrictions and could communicate with the cooks to ensure the best tasting meal possible, within that special diet. She even suggested and confirmed backup order just in case the first options weren't possible. All this, even with St. Patrick's Day chaos all around. When the food came out, it was perfect and she soon checked in with us to make sure it was. We'll be back!

First bar I went into when I moved to boulder. I was initially impressed by their whiskey and cocktail selection. However, the bartender was kind of rude. The food portions are huge and pretty decent though. Gave the bar a couple more shots here and there over the past year or so, but I tend to get the “I don’t want to be here vibe” from the bartenders, so I never stay long. Both places next door are much more inviting, even if you have to join a cult to get into one of em.

Awesome if you come here in a big group and actually get attention. Bad if you’re alone, and like to eat at the sushi bar. Sushi is decent considering you’re in Colorado. However, it is REALLY hard for me to come back here because of how terrible the service is if you come alone. Servers are barely knowledgeable of what is in the food and really don’t want to answer your questions anyways. I ONLY recommend this place for large groups.

Legit Awesome sushi in Boulder.  I recommend eating at the sushi bar, as the chefs here are super awesome and talented, so watching them construct the rolls for the whole restaurant is always a Super fun experience.  Seriously, everything on their menu is awesome, so you really can't go wrong, regardless of what you get.

Always a fun experience and the staff is delightfully kind. It’s Colorado sushi, so... ya know. But good for what it is! Also if you happen to land there on a karaoke night, you’re in for a treat. Great gluten free options. I love the cucumber seaweed salad.
Delicious food and great atmosphere. A bit pricey for the amount of food though. The drinks were good but in plain glasses and pretty pricey as well.

Really excellent Sushi.  I was staying at the Boulderado next door and the location couldn’t have been better off the main Pearl Street.  Service was top notch.  Huge portions, great value.  Will return many times!

We had dinner here to celebrate my wife's enlistment into the Air National Guard.  They took great care of us and they made the dinner extra special.  The scenery and atmosphere were amazing, but the good and the service is what makes this place really special.

Took the wife for a Birthday/Anniversary celebration. Booked the reservation via Open Table and placed a request for a nice table for our special occasion. When we arrived, they had a nice table ready for us and a personalized note on our menus!

As expected, the service was outstanding, and the dining experience was one to remember! Fun drinks and great food.

Our experience was above and beyond! The food was AMAZING! The view was beautiful and the service was perfection! I highly recommend for a special night out. One of my favorite parts was the personalized menu with our names on it!

The customer service was AMAZING! The food was super fancy but we felt like it could have used a little more salt... we’re not super fancy people though so maybe that’s just us. Also the portions seemed really small but we were both full by the end of the meal.
A Boulder landmark. Top shelf food and service. Celebrate your next milestone here with your loved ones.

My husband and I had dinner last night at The Boulder Cork.  We were greeted by Kaitlyn, the charming manager that seated us in a beautiful booth in the dining room.  We were immediately greeted by a friendly bus boy who took great care of our table all night.  Our waiter Christian was friendly, professional and fun!  Our steaks were cooked perfectly and all the sides arrived hot and were yummy.  What a delightful, delicious dining experience.  We LOVE The Boulder Cork!

Excellent Sangria! Great service. Both times I've been here I always tell myself I cant wait to come back! I grew up in Arizona and The Cork really reminds me of home with their southwestern decor. Not to mention the food and happy hour selection is quite filling! I always leave very satisfied.

A great choice for a business lunch. In a hurry, catch their bar area for great, fast options. Good wine list, great menu, always fine service. They have several dinning rooms that are great for small groups.
Came here during Denver Restaurant Week and it was great. Not a big fan of Prime Rib but was talked in to it by my buddy. It was delicious!  Large portion, beautifully cooked, and tasty!
The salmon was excellent. They were able to remove a sauce that would not have worked for me. The waitress was quite friendly. And efficient.

They have really made this place cute!! It was always nice, but now it is cuter, too 😊 Good coffee, friendly staff, quiet easy-listening music, comfy chairs. Very nice.

P.S. I just had the Gluten-free pecan zucchini bread and it was excellent. Not "excellent for Gluten-free", just really really good!!!

Lots of comfy chairs, beautiful art. Delicious coffee. But someone who ordered the same drink after me yanked my drink from the counter, so it took over 15min until I had my coffee in hand. Maybe they should use names on the cups to avoid this ?

Everyone working was perfectly friendly and kind, my chai was fine but not great. Not a lot of room to move between tables. Wish I'd caught this in the reviews though- there are NO OUTLETS AVAILABLE for customers. And I actually totally understand that decision as it limits how long people can camp there. I just had the bad luck of a dead laptop battery when I thought it was full, and not feeling the most emotionally stable to begin with that day. So that just... Hurt my day a lot.  
They seem fine for the majority of things, but it doesn't suit my needs so I probably won't be back.

Nice place for good coffee .. just happened to be convenient for the moment so I stopped in for a latte and a Danish. I liked the music they were playing at a reasonable volume (vs those shops with too loud music) and there's plenty room to meet and converse with friends ... if people do that anymore without their laptops. I recommend giving them a visit.
Good coffee, great baked goods (the owner bakes everything in house!), and good vibes for hanging out and getting some work done :-)
